title: harmony_leiden
description: Run harmony integration followed by neighbour calculations, leiden clustering and run umap on the result.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

id.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample
id.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `dataset.h5mu`. Path to the sample
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `dataset.h5mu`. Path to the sample.

layer.description: Type: `string`, default: `log_normalized`. use specified layer for expression values instead of the
layer.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `log_normalized`. use specified layer for expression values instead of the .X object from the modality.

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Destination path to the output
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Destination path to the output.

uns_neighbors.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `harmonypy_integration_neighbors`. In which .uns slot to store various neighbor output objects.

obsp_neighbor_distances.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `harmonypy_integration_distances`. In which .obsp slot to store the distance matrix between the resulting neighbors.

obsp_neighbor_connectivities.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `harmonypy_integration_connectivities`. In which .obsp slot to store the connectivities matrix between the resulting neighbors.

embedding.description: Type: `string`, default: `X_pca`. Embedding to use as input
embedding.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_pca`. Embedding to use as input

obsm_integrated.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_pca_integrated`. In which .obsm slot to store the resulting integrated embedding.

obs_covariates.description: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `batch;sample`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The
obs_covariates.help_text: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `batch;sample`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The .obs field(s) that define the covariate(s) to regress out.

theta.description: Type: List of `double`, default: `2.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Diversity clustering penalty parameter
theta.help_text:
Type: List of `double`, default: `2.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Diversity clustering penalty parameter. Specify for each variable in group.by.vars. 
theta=0 does not encourage any diversity. Larger values of theta
result in more diverse clusters."

obs_cluster.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `harmony_integration_leiden`. Prefix for the .obs keys under which to add the cluster labels. Newly created columns in .obs will 
be created from the specified value for '--obs_cluster' suffixed with an underscore and one of the resolutions
resolutions specified in '--leiden_resolution'.

leiden_resolution.description: Type: List of `double`, default: `1.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Control the coarseness of the clustering
leiden_resolution.help_text: Type: List of `double`, default: `1.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Control the coarseness of the clustering. Higher values lead to more clusters.

obsm_umap.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_leiden_harmony_umap`. In which .obsm slot to store the resulting UMAP embedding.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
